5176000 5192000 6940000 7043000 15800000 6 12500000 1000000 12565000 15489000 4100000 4100000 0 0 14300000 140455000 150379000 2000000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">15\. LEGAL PROCEEDINGS</font><font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">We and certain current and former officers and directors have been named as defendants in complaints filed by investors in the United States District Court for the District of Colorado. The first complaint was filed in November 2007 and several other complaints were filed shortly thereafter. These actions were consolidated and, in September 2008, the district court appointed a lead plaintiff and counsel. An amended consolidated complaint was filed in December 2008. The amended complaint purports to state claims under Sections&nbsp;10(b), 20(a), and 20A of the Exchange Act on behalf of a class of all persons who purchased our common stock between April&nbsp;2, 2007 and April&nbsp;14, 2008 (the "Class Period"). The amended complaint also added our independent auditor as a defendant. The amended complaint alleges that, during the Class Period, the defendants made false and misleading public statements about us and our business and prospects and, as a result, the market price of our common stock was artificially inflated. The amended complaint also claims that certain current and former officers and directors traded in our common stock on the basis of material non-public information. The amended complaint seeks compensatory damages on behalf of the alleged class in an unspecified amount, including interest, and also added attorneys' fees and costs of litigation. On February&nbsp;28, 2011, the District Court granted motions to dismiss filed by the defendants and dismissed all claims. A final judgment was thereafter entered. Plaintiffs subsequently appealed to the United States Court of Appeals for the Tenth Circuit. We and those current and former officers and directors named as defendants have entered into a Stipulation of Settlement with the plaintiffs that would, if approved by the United States District Court for the District of Colorado, resolve all claims asserted against us by the plaintiffs on behalf of the putative class, and plaintiffs' appeal would be dismissed. Our independent auditor is not a party to the Stipulation of Settlement. The Stipulation of Settlement received preliminary approval from the District Court on August&nbsp;28, 2013. It remains subject to customary conditions, including final court approval following notice to stockholders. On February&nbsp;13, 2014</font><font style="display: inline;">,</font><font style="display: inline;"> a final settlement hearing took place and the parties are awaiting a</font><font style="display: inline;"> final ruling on the settlement</font><font style="display: inline;">. If the settlement becomes final, all amounts required by the settlement will be paid by our insurers. There can be no assurance that the settlement will be finally approved by the District Court, or that approval by the District Court will, if challenged, be upheld by the Tenth Circuit.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">On October 27, 2010, Spectrum Agencies (&#x201C;Spectrum&#x201D;) filed suit against our subsidiary, Crocs Europe B.V. (&#x201C;Crocs Europe&#x201D;), in the High Court of Justice, Queen&#x2019;s Bench Division, Royal Courts of Justice in London, United Kingdom (&#x201C;UK&#x201D;). Spectrum acted as an agent for Crocs products in the UK from 2005 until Crocs Europe terminated the relationship on July 3, 2008 due to Spectrum&#x2019;s breach of its duty to act in good faith towards Crocs Europe. Spectrum alleges that Crocs Europe unlawfully terminated the agency relationship and failed to pay certain sales commissions. A trial on the liability, not quantum (compensation and damages), was held at the High Court in London from November 30, 2011 to December 5, 2011. On December 16, 2011, the High Court of Justice issued a judgment that found that although Spectrum&#x2019;s actions were a breach of its duty to act in good faith towards Crocs Europe the breach was not sufficiently severe to justify termination. We believe that the trial judge erred in his findings and subsequently appealed the judgment.&nbsp;&nbsp;On October 30, 2012, the Court of Appeal handed down its judgment confirming the trial judge&#x2019;s findings. We submitted a request to the Supreme Court seeking permission to appeal.&nbsp;&nbsp;On April 24, 2013 the Supreme Court declined to grant permission to appeal.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given that to date the legal proceedings in this case have only addressed liability, there have been no findings in relation to the amount of compensation or damages other than with respect to legal fees. Under English law, the prevailing party is entitled to reimbursement of reasonable legal fees incurred in the proceedings. We expect that Spectrum will now request to move to the damages phase via a case management conference, during which the Court will provide instructions and schedules leading up to the trial on damages.&nbsp;&nbsp;Spectrum has not formally filed a court claim for compensation and damages and the amount will be assessed later in the proceedings.&nbsp;&nbsp;A trial and judgment on damages could take up to 12 months.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">We are currently subject to an audit by U.S. Customs &amp; Border Protection (&#x201C;CBP&#x201D;) in respect of the period from 2006 to 2010.&nbsp;&nbsp;In October 2013, CBP issued a revised final audit report.&nbsp;In that report CBP projects that unpaid duties totaling approximately $</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">12.4</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million are due for the period under review (a reduction from </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$14.3</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million in the preliminary draft report issued in 2012).&nbsp;&nbsp;We have responded that these projections are erroneous and provided arguments that demonstrate the amount due in connection with this matter is considerably less than the projection.&nbsp; It is not possible at this time to predict whether our arguments will be successful in eliminating or reducing the amount in dispute.&nbsp;&nbsp;CBP has stated that the final report will recommend collection of the duties due.&nbsp;&nbsp;At this time, it is not possible to determine precisely when a notice of claim will be received from CBP, but currently we anticipate a notice of claim could be received sometime in the second or third quarter of 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Likewise, it is not possible to predict with any certainty whether CBP will seek to assert a claim for penalties in addition to any unpaid duties, but such an assertion is a possibility.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">Mexico&#x2019;s Federal Tax Authority (&#x201C;SAT&#x201D;) audited the period from January 2006 to July 2011.&nbsp; There were two phases to the audit, the first for capital equipment and finished goods and the second for raw materials.&nbsp; The first phase was completed and no major discrepancies were noted by the SAT.&nbsp; On January 9, 2013, Crocs received a notice for the second phase in which the SAT issued a tax assessment (taxes and penalties) of roughly </font><font style="display: inline;">280.0</font><font style="display: inline;"> million pesos (approximately $</font><font style="display: inline;">22.0</font><font style="display: inline;"> million) based on the value of all of Crocs&#x2019; imported raw materials during the audit period.&nbsp; We believe that the proposed penalty amount is unfounded and without merit. We filed an appeal by the deadline of March 15, 2013.&nbsp; We have argued that the amount due in connection with the matter, if any, is substantially less than that proposed by the SAT.&nbsp; In connection with the appeal, the SAT required us to post an appeal surety bond in the amount of roughly </font><font style="display: inline;">321.0</font><font style="display: inline;"> million pesos (approximately $</font><font style="display: inline;">26.0</font><font style="display: inline;"> million), which amount reflects estimated additional penalties and interest if we are not successful on our appeal.&nbsp; This amount will be adjusted on an annual basis. We expect it to take between two and three years for resolution of this matter in the Mexican courts.&nbsp; It is not possible at this time to predict the outcome of this matter or reasonably estimate any potential loss.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;background-color:yellow;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">As of March 31, 2014, we have accrued a </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">total of </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$13.4</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million re</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">lating to these litigation matters and other disputes. We estimate that the ulti</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">mate resolution of these litigation matters and other disputes could result in a loss that is reasonably possible between </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$0</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> and </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$10.3</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million in th</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">e aggregate, in excess of the amount accrued. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">Although we are subject to other litigation from time to time in the ordinary course of business, including employment, intellectual property and product liability claims, we are not party to any other pending legal proceedings that we believe will have a material adverse impact on our business, financial position, results of operations or cash flows.</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 182200000 768000 5088000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">8\. </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;">REVOLVING CREDIT FACILITY&nbsp;&amp; BANK BORROWINGS</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Revolving Credit Facility</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">On </font><font style="display: inline;">December 16, 2011</font><font style="display: inline;">, we entered into a</font><font style="display: inline;">n Amended and Restated Credit Agreement</font><font style="display: inline;">, &nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;">(</font><font style="display: inline;">as amended,</font><font style="display: inline;"> the &#x201C;Credit Agreement&#x201D;)</font><font style="display: inline;"> with the lenders named therein and P</font><font style="display: inline;">NC Bank, National Association (&#x201C;</font><font style="display: inline;">PNC</font><font style="display: inline;">&#x201D;</font><font style="display: inline;">), as a lender and admini</font><font style="display: inline;">strative agent for the lenders.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">On March 27, 2014, we entered into the Fourth </font><font style="display: inline;">Amendment to Amended and Restated Credit Agreement (the "Fourth Amendment"), pursuant to which certain te</font><font style="display: inline;">rms of the </font><font style="display: inline;">Credit Agreement were</font><font style="display: inline;"> amended. The Fourth Amendment primarily</font><font style="display: inline;"> (i)&nbsp;alters the minimum fixed</font><font style="display: inline;"> charge coverage ratio from 1.25 to 1.</font><font style="display: inline;">00 to a sca</font><font style="display: inline;">led quarterly ratio of 1.15 to 1.00 in the first and second quarters </font><font style="display: inline;">of 2014</font><font style="display: inline;">,</font><font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;">1.20 to 1.00 in the third and fourth quarters of 2014 and 1.25 to 1.</font><font style="display: inline;">00 </font><font style="display: inline;">at the end of each quarter thereafter</font><font style="display: inline;">, and (ii) amends certain definitions of the financial covenants to beco</font><font style="display: inline;">me more favorable to us</font><font style="display: inline;">.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">As of </font><font style="display: inline;">March 31, 2014 and December 31, 2013</font><font style="display: inline;">, w</font><font style="display: inline;">e had </font><font style="display: inline;">no</font><font style="display: inline;"> outstan</font><font style="display: inline;">ding borrowings under the Credit Agreement. As of </font><font style="display: inline;">March 31, 2014 and December 31, 2013</font><font style="display: inline;">, we had issued and outstanding letters of credit o</font><font style="display: inline;">f $</font><font style="display: inline;">7.3</font><font style="display: inline;"> million an</font><font style="display: inline;">d $</font><font style="display: inline;">7.2</font><font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;million, respectively, which were reserved against the borrowing base under the terms of the Credit Agreement. As of </font><font style="display: inline;">March 31, 2014</font><font style="display: inline;">, we were in compliance with all restrictive financial </font><font style="display: inline;">covenants </font><font style="display: inline;">under the Credit Agreement.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Long-term Bank Borrowings </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">On December&nbsp;10, 2012, we entered into a Master </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">Installment Payment Agreement (&#x201C;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">Master IPA</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&#x201D;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">)</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> with PNC in which PNC finances our </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">purchase of software and services, which may include but are not limited to third party costs to design, install and implement software systems, and associated hardware described in the schedules defined within the Master IPA. Th</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">e Master IPA</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> was entered into to finance our implementation of a new enterprise resource p</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">lanning (&#x201C;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">ERP</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&#x201D;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">) system which began in October 2012 and is estimated to continue through late 2014. The terms of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">each note payable under the Master IPA</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> consist of variable interest rates and payment terms based on amounts borrowed and timing of activity throughout the implementation of the ERP system.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;background-color:yellow;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">As of As of March&nbsp;31, 2014, the notes bear interest rates ranging fr</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">om </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">2.45%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> to </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">2.79%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> and maturities ranging from </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">September 2016</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> to </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">September 2017</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">. As t</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">his debt arrangement relates solely to the construction and implementation of an ERP system for use by the entity, all interest expense in</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">curred under the arrangement has been capitalized to the </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">condensed </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">consolidated balance sheets until the assets are ready for intended use and will be amortized over the useful life of the software upon that date. #000000 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt 6.5pt"> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">Executive may earn from 50% to 200% of the target number of RSUs based on the level of achievement of the performance goal.</font></p> </td> <td valign="top" style="width:110.20pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt solid #000000 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt 6.5pt"> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">Earned RSUs vest 50% upon satisfaction of performance goal and 50% one year later.</font></p> </td> </tr> </table></div> <p </tr> </table></div><hr style="border-bottom-style:solid;width:47%;height:.85pt; ;color:#000000" align="left"></hr> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:9pt;font-size:5pt;top:-4pt;position:relative;line-height:100%">(1)</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:9pt;font-size:5pt;top:-4pt;position:relative;line-height:100%;font-size: 10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-indent:0pt;margin-left:0pt;padding:0pt 36pt 0pt 0pt;"></font><font style="display: inline;font-size:9pt;"></font><font style="display: inline;font-size:9pt;">Includes a corporate component consisting primarily of corporate support and administrative functions, costs associated with share-based compensation, research and development, brand marketing, legal, depreciation and amortization of corporate and other assets not allocated to operating segments and costs of the same nature related to certain corporate holding companies.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 200000 200000 0 202133000 600000 800000 1000000 300000 1000 321000000 26000000 2200000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">12\. SERIES A PREFERRED STOCK</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">On January&nbsp;27, 2014, we issued to Blackstone, and certain of its permitted transferees (together with Blackstone, the &#x201C;Blackstone Purchasers&#x201D;), 200,000 shares of our Series&nbsp;A preferred stock for an aggregate purchase price of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">$198.0</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;million, or </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">$990</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> per share, pursuant to an Investment Agreement between us and Blackstone, dated December&nbsp;28, 2013 (as amended, the &#x201C;Investment Agreement&#x201D;). In connection with the issuance of the Series A preferred stock (the &#x201C;Closing&#x201D;), we received proceeds of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">$182.2</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> million after deducting the issuance discount of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">$2.0</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> million and direct and incremental expenses of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">$15.8</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> million including financial advisory fees, closing costs, legal expenses and other offering-related expenses.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Participation Rights and </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Dividends</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">The Series&nbsp;A preferred stock ranks senior to our common stock with respect to dividend rights and rights on liquidation, winding-up and dissolution. The Series&nbsp;A preferred stock has a stated value of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">$1,000</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> per share, and holders of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock are entitled to cumulative dividends payable quarterly in cash at a rate of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">6%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> per annum. If we fail to make timely dividend payments, the dividend rate will increase to </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">8%</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> per annum until such time as all accrued but unpaid dividends have been paid in full. Holders of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock are entitled to receive dividends declared or paid on our common stock and are entitled to vote together with the holders of our common stock as a single class, in each case, on an as-converted basis. As of March 31, 2014, we had accrued dividends of $2.1 million on the condensed consolidated balance sheets, which were paid in cash to Blackstone on April 1, 2014. Holders of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock have certain limited special approval rights, including with respect to the issuance of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">pari passu</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> or senior equity securities of the Company.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Conversion Features</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">The Series&nbsp;A preferred stock is convertible at the option of the holders at any time after the Closing into shares of common stock at an implied conversion price of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">$14.50</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> per share, subject to adjustment. At our election, all or a portion of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock will be convertible into the relevant number of shares of common stock on or after the third anniversary of the Closing, if the closing price of the common stock equals or exceeds </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">$29.00</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> for 20 consecutive trading days. The Series A preferred stock are convertible into </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">13,793,100</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> shares of our common stock based on the conversion rate currently in place. The conversion rate is subject to customary anti-dilution and other adjustments.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Redemption Features</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">At any time after the eighth anniversary of the Closing, we will have the right to redeem and the holders of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock will have the right to require us to repurchase, all or any portion of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock at 100% of the stated value thereof plus all accrued but unpaid dividends. Upon certain change of control events involving us, the holders can require us to repurchase the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock at 101% of the stated value thereof plus all accrued but unpaid dividends. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">In accordance with FASB ASC Topic 480-10-S99-3A, </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">SEC Staff Announcement: Classification and Measurement of Redeemable Securities</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">, redemption features which are not solely within the control of the issuer are required to be presented outside of permanent equity on the condensed consolidated balance sheets. Under the Investment Agreement and as noted above, the holder has the option to redeem the Series A preferred stock any time after January 27, 2022 or upon a change in control. As such, the Series A preferred stock is presented in temporary or mezzanine equity on the condensed consolidated balance sheets and will be accreted up to the stated redemption value of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">$202.1</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> million using an appropriate accretion method over a redemption period of eight year</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">s, as this represents the earliest proba</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ble date at which the Series A preferred s</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">tock will become redeemable</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Designation</font><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;"> of Board </font><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">of </font><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Directors</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">The Invest</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">ment Agreement grants Blackstone certain rights to designate directors to serve on our Board. For so long as Blackstone and its permitted transferees (i)&nbsp;beneficially own at least 95% of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock or the as-converted common stock purchased pursuant to the Investment Agreement or (ii)&nbsp;maintain beneficial ownership of at least 12.5% of the our outstanding common stock (the "Two-Director Threshold"), Blackstone will have the right to designate for nomination two directors to our Board. For so long as Blackstone and its permitted transferees beneficially own shares of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock or the as-converted common stock purchased pursuant to the Investment Agreement that represent less than the Two-Director Threshold but more than 25% of the number of shares of the as-converted common stock purchased pursuant to the Investment Agreement, Blackstone will have the right to designate for nomination one director to our Board. The directors designated by Blackstone are entitled to serve on Board committees, subject to applicable law and stock exchange rules, and one of such directors must be appointed to the newly-formed committee tasked with identifying a new chief executive officer to fill the vacancy resulting from Mr.&nbsp;McCarvel's resignation. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Restrictions of the Holder</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">Pursuant to the Investment Agreement, Blackstone is subject to certain standstill restrictions which restrict Blackstone from acquiring more than 25% of our outstanding common stock until the date on which Blackstone is no longer entitled to designate any directors to the Board. In addition, subject to certain customary exceptions, Blackstone is restricted from transferring the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">until the second anniversary of the Closing and, for so long as any Series&nbsp;A preferred stock is outstanding, may not transfer the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock to certain of our competitors (as defined in the Investment Agreement) or holders of 25% or more of our common stock. Blackstone also has certain preemptive rights and information rights under the Investment Agreement, which are subject to certain conditions.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Registration Rights Agreement </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">On January&nbsp;27, 2014, we and the Blackstone Purchasers entered into a Registration Rights Agreement (the "Registration Rights Agreement"), pursuant to which we have agreed to provide to the Blackstone Purchasers certain customary demand and piggyback registration rights in respect of the shares of Series&nbsp;A preferred stock and any shares of common stock issued upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;A preferred stock. The Registration Rights Agreement contains customary terms and conditions, including certain customary indemnification obligations. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 14.94 false \--12-31 Q1 2014 2014-03-31 10-Q 0001334036 87532602 Large Accelerated Filer Crocs, Inc. crox 11942000 17025000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p><p style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;;font-size: 10pt"><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"></font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">5\. </font></p><p style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;;font-size: 12pt"><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:12pt;"></font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">13</font><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">. COMMITMENTS &amp; CONTINGENCIES</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Rental Commitments and Contingencies</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">We rent space for certain of our retail stores, offices, warehouses, vehicles, and equipment under operating leases expiring at various dates thro</font><font style="display: inline;">ugh 2033. C</font><font style="display: inline;">ertain leases contain rent escalation clauses (step rents) that require additional rental amounts in the later years of the term. Rent expense for leases with step rents or rent holidays is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term. Deferred rent is included in the </font><font style="display: inline;">condensed </font><font style="display: inline;">consolidated balance sheets in &#x2018;Accrued expenses and other current liabilities.&#x2019;</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">The following table summarizes the composition of rent expense under operating leases for the three </font><font style="display: inline;">months ended March 31, 2014 and 2013</font><font style="display: inline;"> (in thousands):</font> </p> <div style="width:100%"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;"> <tr> <td valign="bottom" style="width:34.50%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:1pt;">&nbsp;</font></p> </td> <td valign="bottom" style="width:03.76%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 Roman;height:1.00pt;overflow:hidden;font-size:0pt;"> &nbsp;</p> </td> <td valign="bottom" style="width:03.76%;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 million during the three months ended March 31, 2014 and 2013.</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:9pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Purchase Commitments</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">As of </font><font style="display: inline;">March 31, 2014</font><font style="display: inline;">, we had purchase commitments with certain third party manufacturers </font><font style="display: inline;">for $</font><font style="display: inline;">210.4</font><font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;million</font><font style="display: inline;">.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Government Tax Audits</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">We are regularly subject to, and are currently undergoing, audits by tax authorities in the United States and several foreign jurisdictions for prior tax years. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">In April 2014, we received a notice of proposed assessment on certain transfer pricing items from Canadian tax authorities, which closes the ongoing audit of our Canada operations through 2011. The assessment, along with the estimated impact on certain Canadian provinces, is l</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ess than the amount of the uncertain tax benefits recorded, and therefore, will result in a net tax benefit of approximately </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$2.2</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million in the qu</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">arter ending June 30, 2014. </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">We intend to pay the assessment, which includes tax and interest for these periods.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">See </font><font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Note&nbsp;15&#x2014;Legal Proceedings</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> for further details regarding potential loss contingencies related to government tax audits and other current legal proceedings.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 0.001 0.001 250000000 250000000 91662656 91987136 88450203 87888964 92000 92000 24943000 8144000 16231000 8915000 145807000 156202000 1600000 1300000 800000 500000 0.0279 0.0245 2017-09-01 2016-09-01 4440000 4521000 19628000 19688000 11199000 11193000 6100000 5400000 10264000 401000 5371000 2117000 2542000 1278000 1150000 2776000 9373000 334000 5090000 1599000 2448000 1406000 902000 2684000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">7\. DERIVATIVE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">We transact business in various foreign countries and are therefore exposed to foreign currency exchange rate risk inherent in revenues, costs, and monetary assets and liabilities denominated in non-functional currencies. We have entered into foreign currency exchange forward contract</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">s</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> and currency swap derivative instruments to selectively protect against volatility in the value of non-functional currency denominated monetary assets and liabilities, and of future cash flows caused by changes in foreign currency exchange rates. We do not designate these derivative instruments as hedging instruments under the accounting standards for derivatives and hedging. Accordingly, these instruments are recorded at fair value as a derivative asset or liability on the balance sheet with their corresponding change in fair value rec</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ognized in &#x2018;Foreign currency transaction (gains) losses, net&#x2019; in our condensed consolidated statements of income. For purposes of the condensed consolidated statement of cash flows, we classify the cash flows at settlement from undesignated instruments in the same category as the cash flows from the related hedged items, generally within &#x2018;Cash provided by (used in) operating activities&#x2019;. See</font><font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;"> Note 6 &#x2013; Fair Value Measurements</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> for further details regarding the fair values of the corresponding derivative assets and liab</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ilities. As of March 31, 2014, we did not have derivative assets or liabilities on our condensed consolidated balance sheets as all derivative forward contracts described in the table below were entered into on March 31, 2014.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">The following table summarizes the notional amounts of the outstanding foreign currency exchange contracts at </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">March 31, 2014 and December 31, 2013</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">. The notional amounts of the derivative financial instruments shown below are denominated in their U</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">nited States (&#x201C;U.S.&#x201D;) D</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ollar equivalents and represent the amount of all contracts of the foreign currency specified. These notional values do not necessarily rep</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">resent amounts exchanged by the parties and, therefore, are not a direct measure of our exposure to the foreign currency exchange risks.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt"> <font style="display: losses, net</font></p> </td> </tr> </table></div> <p style="margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">The accou</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">nt 'Foreign currency transaction gains (losses), net' on the c</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">ondensed consolidated statements of income includes both realized and unrealized gains/losses from underlying foreign currency activity and derivative contracts. These gains and losses are reported on a net basis. </font><font style="display: inline;">For the three months ended </font><font style="display: inline;">March 31, 2014</font><font style="display: inline;">, the n</font><font style="display: inline;">et loss recognized of </font><font style="display: inline;">$2.8</font><font style="display: inline;"> million record</font><font style="display: inline;">ed o</font><font style="display: inline;">n &nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;">the condensed consolidated statements of income </font><font style="display: inline;">is comprised of</font><font style="display: inline;"> a </font><font style="display: inline;">$1.8</font><font style="display: inline;"> million net loss as</font><font style="display: inline;">sociated with our derivative instrument</font><font style="display: inline;">s and a </font><font style="display: inline;">$1.0</font><font style="display: inline;"> million net loss associated with</font><font style="display: inline;"> exposure from day-to-day business transactions in various foreign currencies. For the three months ended March 31, 2013</font><font style="display: inline;">, the </font><font style="display: inline;">net </font><font style="display: inline;">loss</font><font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;">rec</font><font style="display: inline;">ognized of </font><font style="display: inline;">$2.6</font><font style="display: inline;"> million recorded on the condensed consolidated statements of income is comprised of a </font><font style="display: inline;">$12.5</font><font style="display: inline;"> million net loss associated with exposure from day-to-day business transaction</font><font style="display: inline;">s in various foreign currencies partially offset by a </font><font style="display: inline;">$9.9</font><font style="display: inline;"> million net gain</font><font style="display: inline;"> associated with o</font><font style="display: inline;">ur derivative instruments.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">9\. STOCK-BASED COMPENSATION</font> </p> <p style="margin:6pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">Stock-based compensation expense is recognized on a straight-line basis over the applicable vesting period. During the three months ended March 31, 2014 and 20</font><font style="display: inline;">13, $</font><font style="display: inline;">4.</font><font style="display: inline;">7</font><font million, r</font><font style="display: inline;">es</font><font style="display: inline;">pect</font><font style="display: inline;">ively, of stock-based compen</font><font style="display: implementation of our ERP system was capitalized to intangible assets. </font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p><p for the remaining three years.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">The following table summarizes the stock option ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;height:12.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right;" nowrap="nowrap"><div style="float:left"></div>13.24&nbsp; </td> </tr> </table></div> <p style="margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Restricted Stock Awards and Units</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">From time to time, we grant </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">restricted stock awards (&#x201C;RSA&#x201D;) and restricted stock units (&#x201C;RSU&#x201D;)</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> to our </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">employees. R</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">SAs and RSUs </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">generally vest over three or four years depending on the terms of the grant.</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">Unvested RSAs have the same rights as those of common shares including voting rights and non-forfeitable dividend rights. However, ownership of unvested RSAs cannot be transferred until they are ve</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">sted. An unvested RSU is a contractual right to receive a share of common stock only upon its vesting. RSUs have dividend equivalent rights which accrue over the term of the award and are paid if and when the RSUs vest, but they have no voting rights.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">We typically grant time-based RSUs and performance-based RSUs. Time-based RSUs are typically granted on an annual basis to certain non-executive employees and vest in three annual installments on a straight-line basis beginning one year after the grant date. During the three months ended March 31, 2014 and 2013, the board of directors approved gra</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">nts of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">0.3</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million and </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">0.8</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million, respectively, of RSUs to certain non-executives. Performance-based RSUs are typically granted on an annual basis to certain executive employees and consist of a time-based and performance-based component. During the three months ended March 31, 2104 and 2013, the board of directors approved the grant of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">an aggregate of </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">1.0</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million and </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">0.6</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million, respectively, of RSU</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">s to certain executives as part of a performance incentive program. </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">During the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, we recorde</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">d &nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$3.7</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million and </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$2.7</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million, resp</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ectively, of stock-based payment expense related to RSUs. </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">The following represents the vesting schedule of performance-based RSUs granted in 2014: </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <div style="width:100%"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" align="center" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:5.4pt;"> <tr> <td valign="middle" style="width:122.40pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt solid #000000 ;height:21.60pt;padding:0pt 6.5pt"> <p style="margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">Time Vested RSUs</font></p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 0.75pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">(50% of Award)</font></p> </td> <td colspan="3" valign="middle" style="width:330.50pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt solid #000000 ;height:21.60pt;padding:0pt 6.5pt"> <p </td> </tr> <tr> <td rowspan="2" valign="top" style="width:122.40pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt solid #000000 year after the date of grant</font></p> </td> <td valign="top" style="width:110.15pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 ;border-bottom:1pt solid #000000 ;border-right:1pt the target number of RSUs based on the level of achievement of the performance goal.</font></p> </td> <td valign="top" style="width:110.20pt;border-top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt solid #000000 2013</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">, approximate</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ly </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">1.</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">5</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;million </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">options and RSUs in total were not included in the calculation of diluted EPS as their effect would have been anti-dilutive. </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">In addition to the antidilutive effects of options and RSUs, we did not assume the conversion of the Series A preferred stock into common shares for purposes of calculating diluted EPS as the e</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">ffects would have been anti-dilutive. If converted, as of March 31, 2014, the Series A preferred stock would represent approximately </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">13.5%</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> of</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> our common stock outstanding or </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">13.8</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million additional common shares. </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">See </font><font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Note 12 &#x2013; Series A Preferred Stock</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> for further details regarding the preferred share offering.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Stock Repurchase Plan Authorizations</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">We continue to evaluate options to maximize the returns on our cash and maintain an appropriate capital structure, including, among other alte</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">rnatives, repurchases of our common stock. Subject to certain restrictions on repurchases under our revolving credit facility,</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> we have authorization to repurchase up to </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">$350.0</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;"> million of our common stock. </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">The number, price,</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> structure and timing of the repurchases, if any, will be at </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">our</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> sole discretion and future repurchases will be evaluated by </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">us</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> depending on market conditions, liquidity needs and other factors. Share repurchases may be made in the open market or in privately negotiated transactions. The repurchase authorization does not have an expiration date and does not oblige us to acquire any particular amount of our common stock. The </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">board of directors</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> may suspend, modify or terminate the repurchase program at any time without prior notice. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: aggregate price of approximate</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">ly </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">$13.0</font><font </table></div> <p style="margin:0pt;line-height:normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt 6pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Non-Recurring Fair Value Measurements</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">The majority </font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">of our non-financial instrument assets</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">, which include inventories, property and equipment and intangible assets, are not required to be carried at fair value on a recurring basis. However, if certain triggering events occur such that a non-financial instrument is required to be evaluated for impairment and the carrying value is not recoverable, the carrying value would be adjusted to the lower of its cost or fair value and an impai</font><font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">rment charge would be recorded.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 65633000 4548000 4272000 49665000 6439000 709000 68964000 4378000 4462000 53051000 6437000 636000 18340000 10108000 9702000 11663000 14285000 14717000 137850000 4548000 6501000 118940000 6878000 983000 147779000 4378000 6626000 129013000 6781000 981000 72217000 2229000 69275000 439000 274000 78815000 2164000 75962000 344000 345000 13501000 13501000 984000 984000 -2600000 -2768000 -2982000 5708000 23653000 25756000 -9941000 1838000 2508000 2499000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">4\. <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">1\. GENERAL</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Organization</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">Crocs,&nbsp;Inc. and its subsidiaries (collectively the &#x201C;Company,&#x201D; &#x201C;we,&#x201D; &#x201C;our&#x201D; or &#x201C;us&#x201D;) are engaged in the design, development, manufacturing, marketing and distribution of footwear, apparel and accessories for men, women and children.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Basis of Presentation</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">The accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (&#x201C;GAAP&#x201D;) for interim financial information and with the rules&nbsp;and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;) for reporting on Form&nbsp;10-Q. The condensed consolidated balance sheet as of December 31, 2013 was derived from the Company&#x2019;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2013 (the &#x201C;2013 Form 10-K</font><font style="display: inline;">&#x201D;)</font><font style="display: inline;">. Accordingly, these statements do not include all of the information and disclosures required by GAAP or SEC rules&nbsp;and regulations for complete financial statements. In the opinion of management, these financial statements reflect all adjustments (consisting solely of normal recurring matters) considered necessary for a fair presentation of the results for the interim periods presented. The results of operations for any interim period are not necessarily indicative of results for the full year.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">These statements should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and footnotes included in the 2013 Form&nbsp;10-K. The accounting policies used in preparing these unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements are the same as those described in </font><font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;">Note&nbsp;1 &#x2013; Organization &amp; Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</font><font style="display: inline;"> to the consolidated financial statements in the 2013 Form&nbsp;10-K.</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Earnings Per Share</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> \- Basic and diluted earnings per common share (&#x201C;EPS&#x201D;) is presented using the two-class method, which is an earnings allocation formula that determines earnings per share for common stock and any participating securities according to dividend rights and participation rights in undistributed earnings. Under the two-class method, EPS is computed by dividing the sum of distributed and undistributed earnings attributable to common stockholders by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the period. A participating security is a security that may participate in undistributed earnings with common stock had those earnings been distributed in any form. Our recently issued Series A Convertible Preferred Stock (&#x201C;Series A preferred stock&#x201D;) represent participating securities as holders of the Series A preferred stock are entitled to receive any and all dividends declared or paid on common stock on an as-converted basis. In addition, shares of our non-vested restricted stock awards are considered participating securities as they represent unvested share-based payment awards containing non-forfeitable rights to dividends. As such, these participating securities must be included in the computation of EPS pursuant to the two-class method on a pro-rata, as-converted basis. Diluted EPS reflects the potential dilution from securities that could share in our earnings. In addition, the dilutive effect of each participating security is calculated using the more dilutive of the two-class method described above, which assumes that the securities remain in their current form, or the if-converted method, which assumes conversion to common stock as of the beginning of the reporting date. Anti-dilutive securities are excluded from diluted EPS. See </font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-style:italic;">Note&nbsp;11&#x2014;Earnings Per Share</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;"> for further discussion.</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Recently Adopted Accounting Standards</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-size:10pt;">In July 2013, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued ASU No.&nbsp;2013-11 </font><font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">Income Taxes (Topic 740): Presentation of an Unrecognized Tax Benefit when a Net Operating Loss C</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;">arryforward, a Similar Tax Loss, or a Tax Credit Carryforward Exists</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;"> (&#x201C;ASU No.&nbsp;2013-11&#x201D;). This pronouncement provides guidance on financial statement presentation of an unrecognized tax benefit (&#x201C;UTB&#x201D;) when a net operating loss (&#x201C;NOL&#x201D;) carryforward, a similar tax loss or a tax credit carryforward exists. Under the pronouncement, an entity must present a UTB, or a portion of the UTB, in the financial statements as a reduction to a deferred tax asset (&#x201C;DTA&#x201D;) for an NOL carryforward, a similar tax loss or a tax credit carryforward except when: </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 12pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">1)</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">An NOL carryforward, a similar tax loss or a tax credit carryforward is not available as of the reporting date under the governing tax law to settle that would result from the disallowance of the tax position. </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">2)</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">&nbsp;</font><font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;">The entity does not intend to use the DTA for this purpose (provided that the tax law permits a choice). </font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-family:Times;font-size:10pt;">If either of these conditions exists, an entity should present a UTB in the financial statements as a liability and should not net the UTB with a DTA. This amendment does not affect the amounts disclosed in the tabular reconciliation of the total amounts of UTBs because the tabular reconciliation presents gross amounts of UTBs. This pronouncement is effective for fiscal years and interim periods within those fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2013. The Company adopted this pronouncement on January&nbsp;1, 2014. The adoption of this pronouncement did not have a material impact to the Company's consolidated financial position or results of operations.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 6513000 11540000 53661000 40930000 -3000 0 4317000 980000 15201000 15934000 -419000 -49000 28000 141000 115000 868000 12661000 13031000 0 15800000 669000 5745000 10247000 9889000 5089000 2133000 0.001 0.001 5000000 5000000 0 0 29175000 34559000 603000 518000 182220000 12173000 515000 <div> <div style="margin-left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"> <p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;">3\. &#x2018;S</font><font style="display: inline;">elling, gener</font><font style="display: inline;">al and administrative expenses&#x2019; i</font><font style="display: inline;">n the </font><font style="margin:0pt 0pt 12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Asset Impairments</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">We periodically evaluate all of our long-lived assets for impairment when events or circ</font><font style="display: inline;">umstances would indicate the carrying value of a lo</font><font style="display: inline;">ng-lived asset may not </font><font style="display: inline;">be fully recoverable. </font><font style="display: inline;">During the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, we recorded </font><font style="display: inline;">no</font><font style="display: inline;"> charges related to asset impairments.</font> </p> <p style="margin:12pt 0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;">Retail Store</font><font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;"> Closings</font> </p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"> <font style="display: inline;">During the three months ended March 31, 2014, we closed two retail locations in our Europe segment which were not scheduled to close until future periods and were selected for closure by management based on historical and projected profitability levels, relocation plans, and other factors. As of March 31, 2014, we recorded a liability of approximately </font><font style="display: inline;">$0.7</font><font style="display: inline;"> million related to these locations in &#x2018;</font><font style="display: inline;">Accrued expenses and other current liabilities</font><font style="display: inline;">&#x2019; on the condensed consolidated balance sheets with a related expense in &#x2018;Selling, general and administrative expenses&#x2019; on the condensed consolidated statements of income. The calculation of accrued store closing reserves primarily includes future minimum lease payments from the date of closure to the end of the remaining lease term, net of contractual or estimated sublease income. We record the liability at fair value in the period in which the store is closed.</font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p><p style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;;font-size: 10pt"><font style="display: inline;"></font> </p> <p><font size="1"> </font></p> </div> </div> 185122000 189275000 86971000 86413000 <div>
